trans-unit.source: If you want to show a tooltip immediately, while the mouse is moving (e.g., to get the mouse coordinates with QMouseEvent::pos() and show them as a tooltip), you must first enable mouse tracking as described above. Then, to ensure that the tooltip is updated immediately, you must call QToolTip::showText() instead of setToolTip() in your implementation of mouseMoveEvent().
trans-unit.target: Si desea mostrar una información sobre herramientas inmediatamente, mientras el mouse se está moviendo (por ejemplo, para obtener las coordenadas del mouse con QMouseEvent :: pos () y mostrarlas como información sobre herramientas), primero debe habilitar el seguimiento del mouse como se describe arriba. Luego, para asegurarse de que la información sobre herramientas se actualice inmediatamente, debe llamar a QToolTip :: showText () en lugar de setToolTip () en su implementación de mouseMoveEvent ().

trans-unit.source: If you want to sort your strings in an arbitrary order, consider using the QMap class. For example, you could use a QMap<QString, QString> to create a case-insensitive ordering (e.g. with the keys being lower-case versions of the strings, and the values being the strings), or a QMap<int, QString> to sort the strings by some integer index.
trans-unit.target: Si desea ordenar sus cadenas en un orden arbitrario, considere usar la clase QMap . Por ejemplo, podría usar un QMap < QString , QString > para crear un orden que no distinga entre mayúsculas y minúsculas (por ejemplo, con las claves siendo versiones en minúsculas de las cadenas y los valores siendo las cadenas), o un QMap <int, QString > para ordenar las cadenas por algún índice entero.

trans-unit.source: If you want to store a single block of data (e.g., a comment), you can pass an empty key, or use a generic key like "Description".
trans-unit.target: Si desea almacenar un solo bloque de datos (por ejemplo,un comentario),puede pasar una clave vacía,o utilizar una clave genérica como "Descripción".

trans-unit.source: If you want to support several different ABIs in your application in Google Play, the recommendation is to build an Application App Bundle (AAB) containing binaries for each of the ABIs. Based on your AAB, Google Play generates optimized Application Packages (APK) for each device requesting a download.

If you want to support several different architectures in your application, the recommendation is to build separate APKs for each architecture, so that each APK only contains the binaries required for the targeted architecture. For more information about this, see the Android documentation about Multiple APK Support.
trans-unit.target: Si desea admitir varias arquitecturas diferentes en su aplicación, la recomendación es crear APK separados para cada arquitectura, de modo que cada APK solo contenga los archivos binarios necesarios para la arquitectura de destino. Para obtener más información sobre esto, consulte la documentación de Android sobre compatibilidad con varios APK .

trans-unit.source: If you wish to introduce a delay between animations in a QSequentialAnimationGroup, you can insert a QPauseAnimation. This class does not animate anything, but does not finish before a specified number of milliseconds have elapsed from when it was started. You specify the duration of the pause in the constructor. It can also be set directly with setDuration().
trans-unit.target: Si desea introducir un retraso entre animaciones en un QSequentialAnimationGroup , puede insertar un QPauseAnimation . Esta clase no anima nada, pero no termina antes de que haya transcurrido un número específico de milisegundos desde que se inició. La duración de la pausa se especifica en el constructor. También se puede configurar directamente con setDuration ().

trans-unit.source: If your Item uses the Behavior type to define animations for property changes, you should always use either QObject::setProperty(), QQmlProperty(), or QMetaProperty::write() when you need to modify those properties from C++. This ensures that the QML engine knows about the property change. Otherwise, the engine won't be able to carry out your requested animation. Note that these functions incur a slight performance penalty. For more details, see Accessing Members of a QML Object Type from C++.
trans-unit.target: Si su elemento usa el tipo de comportamiento para definir animaciones para cambios de propiedad, siempre debe usar QObject :: setProperty (), QQmlProperty () o QMetaProperty :: write () cuando necesite modificar esas propiedades desde C ++. Esto asegura que el motor QML conozca el cambio de propiedad. De lo contrario, el motor no podrá realizar la animación solicitada. Tenga en cuenta que estas funciones conllevan una ligera penalización de rendimiento. Para obtener más detalles, consulte Acceso a miembros de un tipo de objeto QML desde C ++ .

Consulte la sección anterior sobre Inicialización diferida para obtener más información.

trans-unit.target: Si su aplicación tiene productos desbloqueables y no almacena los estados de compra de estos productos de forma que sea posible restaurarlos cuando el usuario reinstale la aplicación,debe proporcionar una forma para que el usuario restaure las compras manualmente.

trans-unit.source: If your application is very simple, it may be possible to store the entire application state in additional command line options. This is usually a very bad idea because command lines are often limited to a few hundred bytes. Instead, use QSettings, temporary files, or a database for this purpose. By marking the data with the unique sessionId(), you will be able to restore the application in a future session.
trans-unit.target: Si su aplicación es muy simple, es posible almacenar el estado completo de la aplicación en opciones de línea de comando adicionales. Esta suele ser una muy mala idea porque las líneas de comando suelen estar limitadas a unos pocos cientos de bytes. En su lugar, utilice QSettings , archivos temporales o una base de datos para este propósito. Al marcar los datos con el sessionId () único , podrá restaurar la aplicación en una sesión futura.

trans-unit.source: If your application loads a large image but displays it in a small-sized element, set the "sourceSize" property to the size of the element being rendered to ensure that the smaller-scaled version of the image is kept in memory, rather than the large one.
trans-unit.target: Si su aplicación carga una imagen grande pero la muestra en un elemento de tamaño pequeño,establezca la propiedad "sourceSize" en el tamaño del elemento que se está renderizando para asegurarse de que la versión de menor escala de la imagen se mantiene en la memoria,en lugar de la grande.

trans-unit.source: If your effect changes, use update() to request for a redraw. If your custom effect changes the bounding rectangle of the source, e.g., a radial glow effect may need to apply an extra margin, you can reimplement the virtual boundingRectFor() function, and call updateBoundingRect() to notify the framework whenever this rectangle changes. The virtual sourceChanged() function is called to notify the effects that the source has changed in some way - e.g., if the source is a QGraphicsRectItem and its rectangle parameters have changed.
trans-unit.target: Si su efecto cambia, use update () para solicitar un redibujo. Si su efecto personalizado cambia el rectángulo delimitador de la fuente, por ejemplo, un efecto de brillo radial puede necesitar aplicar un margen adicional, puede volver a implementar la función virtual boundingRectFor () y llamar a updateBoundingRect () para notificar al marco cada vez que este rectángulo cambie. La función virtual sourceChanged () se llama para notificar los efectos de que la fuente ha cambiado de alguna manera, por ejemplo, si la fuente es un QGraphicsRectItem y sus parámetros de rectángulo han cambiado.

trans-unit.source: If your goal is orthogonal surveillance of eventpoints, an older alternative was QObject::installEventFilter(), but that has never been a built-in QtQuick feature: it requires some C++ code, such as a QQuickItem subclass. PointHandler is more efficient than that, because only pointer events will be delivered to it, during the course of normal event delivery in QQuickWindow; whereas an event filter needs to filter all QEvents of all types, and thus sets itself up as a potential event delivery bottleneck.
trans-unit.target: Si su objetivo es la vigilancia ortogonal de los puntos de evento, una alternativa anterior era QObject :: installEventFilter () , pero esa nunca ha sido una característica integrada de QtQuick : requiere algo de código C ++, como una subclase QQuickItem . PointHandler es más eficiente que eso, porque solo se le entregarán eventos de puntero, durante el curso de la entrega de eventos normal en QQuickWindow ; mientras que un filtro de eventos necesita filtrar todos los QEvents de todos los tipos y, por lo tanto, se configura como un posible cuello de botella en la entrega de eventos.

trans-unit.source: If your goal is orthogonal surveillance of eventpoints, an older alternative was QObject::installEventFilter(), but that has never been a built-in QtQuick feature: it requires some C++ code, such as a QQuickItem subclass. PointHandler is more efficient than that, because only pointer events will be delivered to it, during the course of normal event delivery in QQuickWindow; whereas an event filter needs to filter all QEvents of all types, and thus sets itself up as a potential event delivery bottleneck.

If your goal is orthogonal surveillance of eventpoints, an older alternative was QObject::installEventFilter(), but that has never been a built-in QtQuick feature: it requires some C++ code, such as a QQuickItem subclass. PointHandler is more efficient than that, because only pointer events will be delivered to it, during the course of normal event delivery in QQuickWindow; whereas an event filter needs to filter all QEvents of all types, and thus sets itself up as a potential event delivery bottleneck.
If your item is displayed in several areas then visualRect should return the primary area that contains index and not the complete area that index might encompasses, touch or cause drawing.
trans-unit.target: Si su artículo se muestra en varias áreas,entonces visualRect debería devolver el área primaria que contiene el índice y no el área completa que el índice podría abarcar,tocar o causar el dibujo.

trans-unit.source: If your model is sortable, i.e, if it reimplements the QAbstractItemModel::sort() function, both QTableView and QTreeView provide an API that allows you to sort your model data programmatically. In addition, you can enable interactive sorting (i.e. allowing the users to sort the data by clicking the view's headers), by connecting the QHeaderView::sortIndicatorChanged() signal to the QTableView::sortByColumn() slot or the QTreeView::sortByColumn() slot, respectively.
trans-unit.target: Si su modelo se puede ordenar, es decir, si vuelve a implementar la función QAbstractItemModel :: sort (), tanto QTableView como QTreeView proporcionan una API que le permite ordenar los datos de su modelo mediante programación. Además, puede activar la ordenación interactiva (es decir, permitiendo que los usuarios ordenar los datos haciendo clic en los encabezados de la vista), conectando el QHeaderView :: sortIndicatorChanged señal () a la QTableView :: sortByColumn ranura () o la QTreeView :: sortByColumn ( ) ranura, respectivamente.

trans-unit.source: Image plugins are queried first, based on either the optional format string, or the file name suffix (if the source device is a file). No content detection is done at this stage. QImageReader will choose the first plugin that supports reading for this format.
trans-unit.target: Los complementos de imagen se consultan primero, según la cadena de formato opcional o el sufijo del nombre de archivo (si el dispositivo de origen es un archivo). No se realiza ninguna detección de contenido en esta etapa. QImageReader elegirá el primer complemento que admita la lectura para este formato.

trans-unit.source: Image properties
trans-unit.target: Propiedades de la imagen

trans-unit.source: Image providers enable support for pixmap and threaded image requests. See the QQuickImageProvider documentation for details on implementing and using image providers.
trans-unit.target: Los proveedores de imágenes permiten la compatibilidad con mapas de píxeles y solicitudes de imágenes enhebradas. Consulte la documentación de QQuickImageProvider para obtener detalles sobre la implementación y el uso de proveedores de imágenes.

trans-unit.source: Image providers must be registered with the QML engine. The only information the QML engine knows about image providers is the type of image data they provide. To use an image provider to acquire image data, you must cast the QQmlImageProviderBase pointer to a QQuickImageProvider pointer.
trans-unit.target: Los proveedores de imágenes deben estar registrados con el motor QML. La única información que el motor QML conoce sobre los proveedores de imágenes es el tipo de datos de imagen que proporcionan. Para utilizar un proveedor de imágenes para adquirir datos de imágenes, debe convertir el puntero QQmlImageProviderBase en un puntero QQuickImageProvider .

trans-unit.source: Image providers must be registered with the QML engine. The only information the QML engine knows about image providers is the type of image data they provide. To use an image provider to acquire image data, you must cast the QQmlImageProviderBase pointer to a QQuickImageProvider pointer.

Image providers that support QImage or Texture loading automatically include support for asychronous loading of images. To enable asynchronous loading for an image source, set the asynchronous property to true for the relevant Image or BorderImage object. When this is enabled, the image request to the provider is run in a low priority thread, allowing image loading to be executed in the background, and reducing the performance impact on the user interface.

Image providers that support QImage or Texture loading automatically include support for asychronous loading of images. To enable asynchronous loading for an image source, set the asynchronous property to true for the relevant Image, BorderImage or AnimatedImage object. When this is enabled, the image request to the provider is run in a low priority thread, allowing image loading to be executed in the background, and reducing the performance impact on the user interface.
trans-unit.target: Los proveedores de imágenes que admiten la carga de QImage o Texture incluyen automáticamente la compatibilidad con la carga asincrónica de imágenes. Para habilitar la carga asincrónica para una fuente de imagen, establezca la propiedad asynchronous en true para el objeto Image , BorderImage o AnimatedImage relevante . Cuando está habilitado, la solicitud de imagen al proveedor se ejecuta en un hilo de baja prioridad, lo que permite que la carga de la imagen se ejecute en segundo plano y reduce el impacto del rendimiento en la interfaz de usuario.

trans-unit.source: ImageParticles implictly share data on particles if multiple ImageParticles are painting the same logical particle group. This is broken down along the four capabilities listed above. So if one ImageParticle defines data for rendering the particles in one of those capabilities, and the other does not, then both will draw the particles the same in that aspect automatically. This is primarily useful when there is some random variation on the particle which is supposed to stay with it when switching painters. If both ImageParticles define how they should appear for that aspect, they diverge and each appears as it is defined.
trans-unit.target: ImageParticles comparte implícitamente datos sobre partículas si varias ImageParticles están pintando el mismo grupo de partículas lógicas. Esto se desglosa según las cuatro capacidades enumeradas anteriormente. Entonces, si un ImageParticle define datos para representar las partículas en una de esas capacidades, y el otro no, ambos dibujarán las partículas de la misma manera en ese aspecto automáticamente. Esto es principalmente útil cuando hay alguna variación aleatoria en la partícula que se supone debe permanecer con ella cuando se cambia de pintor. Si ambas ImageParticles definen cómo deben aparecer para ese aspecto, divergen y cada una aparece como está definida.

trans-unit.source: ImageParticles implictly share data on particles if multiple ImageParticles are painting the same logical particle group. This is broken down along the four capabilities listed above. So if one ImageParticle defines data for rendering the particles in one of those capabilities, and the other does not, then both will draw the particles the same in that aspect automatically. This is primarily useful when there is some random variation on the particle which is supposed to stay with it when switching painters. If both ImageParticles define how they should appear for that aspect, they diverge and each appears as it is defined.
Images
trans-unit.target: Images

trans-unit.source: Images are a vital part of any user interface. Unfortunately, they are also a big source of problems due to the time it takes to load them, the amount of memory they consume, and the way in which they are used.
trans-unit.target: Las imágenes son una parte vital de cualquier interfaz de usuario.Desafortunadamente,también son una gran fuente de problemas debido al tiempo que lleva cargarlas,la cantidad de memoria que consumen y la forma en que se utilizan.

trans-unit.source: Images are cached and shared internally, so if several Image items have the same source, only one copy of the image will be loaded.
trans-unit.target: Las imágenes se almacenan en caché y se comparten internamente, por lo que si varios elementos de imagen tienen la misma fuente , solo se cargará una copia de la imagen.

trans-unit.source: Images are often quite large, and so it is wise to ensure that loading an image doesn't block the UI thread. Set the "asynchronous" property of the QML Image element to true to enable asynchronous loading of images from the local file system (remote images are always loaded asynchronously) where this would not result in a negative impact upon the aesthetics of the user interface.
trans-unit.target: Las imágenes suelen ser bastante grandes, por lo que es aconsejable asegurarse de que cargar una imagen no bloquee el hilo de la interfaz de usuario. Establezca la propiedad "asincrónica" del elemento Imagen QML en true para permitir la carga asincrónica de imágenes desde el sistema de archivos local (las imágenes remotas siempre se cargan de forma asincrónica) donde esto no resulte en un impacto negativo en la estética de la interfaz de usuario.

trans-unit.source: Images can be supplied in any format for which Qt has an image reader, so SVG drawings can be included alongside PNG, TIFF and other bitmap formats.
trans-unit.target: Las imágenes pueden ser suministradas en cualquier formato para el que Qt tenga un lector de imágenes,por lo que los dibujos SVG pueden ser incluidos junto con PNG,TIFF y otros formatos de mapa de bits.

trans-unit.source: Images in QTextDocument are represented by text fragments that reference external images via the resource mechanism. Images are created using the cursor interface, and can be modified later by changing the character format of the image's text fragment:
trans-unit.target: Las imágenes en QTextDocument están representadas por fragmentos de texto que hacen referencia a imágenes externas mediante el mecanismo de recursos. Las imágenes se crean utilizando la interfaz del cursor y se pueden modificar más tarde cambiando el formato de carácter del fragmento de texto de la imagen:

trans-unit.source: Images returned by a QQuickImageProvider are automatically cached, similar to any image loaded by the QML engine. When an image with a "image://" prefix is loaded from cache, requestImage() and requestPixmap() will not be called for the relevant image provider. If an image should always be fetched from the image provider, and should not be cached at all, set the cache property to false for the relevant Image, BorderImage or AnimatedImage object.
trans-unit.target: Las imágenes devueltas por un QQuickImageProvider se almacenan en caché automáticamente, similar a cualquier imagen cargada por el motor QML. Cuando una imagen con un prefijo "image: //" se carga desde la caché, requestImage () y requestPixmap () no se llamarán para el proveedor de imágenes relevante. Si una imagen siempre debe obtenerse del proveedor de imágenes y no debe almacenarse en caché, establezca la propiedad de cache en false para el objeto Image , BorderImage o AnimatedImage relevante .

trans-unit.source: Images returned by a QQuickImageProvider are automatically cached, similar to any image loaded by the QML engine. When an image with a "image://" prefix is loaded from cache, requestImage() and requestPixmap() will not be called for the relevant image provider. If an image should always be fetched from the image provider, and should not be cached at all, set the cache property to false for the relevant Image or BorderImage object.

trans-unit.source: Imagine that we wanted to add an "interrupt" mechanism to the example discussed in the previous section; the user should be able to click a button to have the state machine perform some non-related task, after which the state machine should resume whatever it was doing before (i.e. return to the old state, which is one of s11, s12 and s13 in this case).
trans-unit.target: Imagine que quisiéramos agregar un mecanismo de "interrupción" al ejemplo discutido en la sección anterior; el usuario debería poder hacer clic en un botón para que la máquina de estado realice alguna tarea no relacionada, después de lo cual la máquina de estado debería reanudar lo que estaba haciendo antes (es decir, volver al estado anterior, que es uno de s11 , s12 y s13 en este caso).

trans-unit.source: Imagine that we wanted to add an "interrupt" mechanism to the example discussed in the previous section; the user should be able to click a button to have the state machine perform some non-related task, after which the state machine should resume whatever it was doing before (i.e. return to the old state, which is one of the three states in this case).
trans-unit.target: Imaginemos que quisiéramos añadir un mecanismo de "interrupción" al ejemplo analizado en la sección anterior;el usuario debería poder hacer clic en un botón para que la máquina de estado realice alguna tarea no relacionada,tras lo cual la máquina de estado debería reanudar lo que estaba haciendo antes (es decir,volver al estado anterior,que es uno de los tres estados en este caso).

trans-unit.target: Inmediatamente establece la propiedad isFullScreen en false . Se puede utilizar para notificar al motor del navegador cuando el sistema de ventanas obliga a la aplicación a salir del modo de pantalla completa.

trans-unit.source: Immediately triggers the painted texture's paint() function, which in turn uploads the new image to the GPU. If you are making multiple changes to a painted texture, consider waiting until all changes are complete before calling update, in order to minimize the number of repaints required.

trans-unit.source: Important notes

Important: please note that this proxy only supports dragging a single row. It will assert if called with indexes from multiple rows, because dragging rows that might come from different source models cannot be implemented generically by this proxy model. Each piece of data in the QMimeData needs to be merged, which is data-type-specific. Reimplement this method in a subclass if you want to support dragging multiple rows.
trans-unit.target: Importante: tenga en cuenta que este proxy solo admite arrastrar una sola fila. Se afirmará si se llama con índices de varias filas, ya que este modelo de proxy no puede implementar de forma genérica las filas que pueden provenir de diferentes modelos de origen. Cada pieza de datos en QMimeData debe fusionarse, lo que es específico del tipo de datos. Vuelva a implementar este método en una subclase si desea admitir el arrastre de varias filas.

trans-unit.source: Imported JavaScript resources are always qualified using the "as" keyword. The qualifier for JavaScript resources must start with an uppercase letter, and must be unique, so there is always a one-to-one mapping between qualifiers and JavaScript files. (This also means qualifiers cannot be named the same as built-in JavaScript objects such as Date and Math).
trans-unit.target: Los recursos JavaScript importados siempre se califican mediante la palabra clave "as". El calificador para los recursos de JavaScript debe comenzar con una letra mayúscula y debe ser único, por lo que siempre hay un mapeo uno a uno entre los calificadores y los archivos de JavaScript. (Esto también significa que los calificadores no pueden tener el mismo nombre que los objetos de JavaScript integrados, como Date y Math ).

trans-unit.source: Imported targets are created for each Qt module. Imported target names should be preferred instead of using a variable like Qt5<Module>_LIBRARIES in CMake commands such as target_link_libraries. The actual path to the library can be obtained using the LOCATION property:
trans-unit.target: Se crean objetivos importados para cada módulo Qt. Deben preferirse los nombres de destino importados en lugar de usar una variable como Qt5 <Module> _LIBRARIES en comandos de CMake como target_link_libraries . La ruta real a la biblioteca se puede obtener usando la propiedad LOCATION :

trans-unit.source: Imported targets are created with the configurations Qt was configured with. That is, if Qt was configured with the -debug switch, an imported target with the configuration DEBUG will be created. If Qt was configured with the -release switch an imported target with the configuration RELEASE will be created. If Qt was configured with the -debug-and-release switch (the default on windows), then imported targets will be created with both RELEASE and DEBUG configurations.
trans-unit.target: Los objetivos importados se crean con las configuraciones con las que Qt fue configurado.Es decir,si Qt fue configurado con el interruptor -debug,se creará un objetivo importado con la configuración DEBUG.Si Qt fue configurado con el interruptor -release,se creará un blanco importado con la configuración RELEASE.Si Qt fue configurado con el interruptor -debug-and-release (el predeterminado en windows),entonces los objetivos importados serán creados con las configuraciones RELEASE y DEBUG.

trans-unit.source: In SQLite any column, with the exception of an INTEGER PRIMARY KEY column, may be used to store any type of value. For instance, a column declared as INTEGER may contain an integer value in one row and a text value in the next. This is due to SQLite associating the type of a value with the value itself rather than with the column it is stored in. A consequence of this is that the type returned by QSqlField::type() only indicates the field's recommended type. No assumption of the actual type should be made from this and the type of the individual values should be checked.
trans-unit.target: En SQLite, cualquier columna, con la excepción de una columna INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, se puede utilizar para almacenar cualquier tipo de valor. Por ejemplo, una columna declarada como INTEGER puede contener un valor entero en una fila y un valor de texto en la siguiente. Esto se debe a que SQLite asocia el tipo de un valor con el valor en sí en lugar de con la columna en la que está almacenado. Una consecuencia de esto es que el tipo devuelto por QSqlField :: type () solo indica el tipo recomendado del campo. No se debe suponer el tipo real a partir de esto y se debe verificar el tipo de los valores individuales.

trans-unit.source: In QByteArray, the notion of uppercase and lowercase and of which character is greater than or less than another character is locale dependent. This affects functions that support a case insensitive option or that compare or lowercase or uppercase their arguments. Case insensitive operations and comparisons will be accurate if both strings contain only ASCII characters. (If $LC_CTYPE is set, most Unix systems do "the right thing".) Functions that this affects include contains(), indexOf(), lastIndexOf(), operator<(), operator<=(), operator>(), operator>=(), isLower(), isUpper(), toLower() and toUpper().
trans-unit.target: En QByteArray , la noción de mayúsculas y minúsculas y de qué carácter es mayor o menor que otro carácter depende de la configuración regional. Esto afecta a las funciones que admiten una opción que no distingue entre mayúsculas y minúsculas o que comparan sus argumentos en minúsculas o mayúsculas. Las operaciones y comparaciones que no distinguen entre mayúsculas y minúsculas serán precisas si ambas cadenas contienen solo caracteres ASCII. (Si se establece $LC_CTYPE , la mayoría de los sistemas Unix hacen "lo correcto".) Las funciones que esto afecta incluyen contiene (), indexOf (), lastIndexOf (), operador <(), operador <= (), operador> () , operador> = (), isLower (), isUpper (), toLower () y toUpper ().

trans-unit.source: In paintGL() the current context is always accessible by caling QOpenGLContext::currentContext(). From this context an already initialized, ready-to-be-used QOpenGLFunctions instance is retrievable by calling QOpenGLContext::functions(). An alternative to prefixing every GL call is to inherit from QOpenGLFunctions and call QOpenGLFunctions::initializeOpenGLFunctions() in initializeGL().
trans-unit.target: En paintGL () siempre se puede acceder al contexto actual llamando a QOpenGLContext :: currentContext (). Desde este contexto, una instancia de QOpenGLFunctions ya inicializada y lista para ser utilizada se puede recuperar llamando a QOpenGLContext :: functions (). Una alternativa al prefijo de cada llamada GL es heredar de QOpenGLFunctions y llamar a QOpenGLFunctions :: initializeOpenGLFunctions () en initializeGL ().

trans-unit.source: In paintGL() the current context is always accessible by caling QOpenGLContext::currentContext(). An alternative to prefixing every GL call is to inherit from QOpenGLFunctions and call QOpenGLFunctions::initializeOpenGLFunctions() in initializeGL().

In paintGL() the current context is always accessible by caling QOpenGLContext::currentContext(). From this context an already initialized, ready-to-be-used QOpenGLFunctions instance is retrievable by calling QOpenGLContext::functions(). An alternative to prefixing every GL call is to inherit from QOpenGLFunctions and call QOpenGLFunctions::initializeOpenGLFunctions() in initializeGL().

trans-unit.source: In FullPageMode the current margins and minimum margins are not taken into account. The paintable rectangle is the full page rectangle, and the current margins can be set to any values regardless of the minimum margins and page size.
trans-unit.target: En FullPageMode, los márgenes actuales y los márgenes mínimos no se tienen en cuenta. El rectángulo que se puede pintar es el rectángulo de página completa, y los márgenes actuales se pueden establecer en cualquier valor independientemente de los márgenes mínimos y el tamaño de la página.

trans-unit.source: In QRegExp, apart from within character classes, ^ always signifies the start of the string, so carets must always be escaped unless used for that purpose. In Perl the meaning of caret varies automagically depending on where it occurs so escaping it is rarely necessary. The same applies to $ which in QRegExp always signifies the end of the string.
trans-unit.target: En QRegExp , además de dentro de las clases de caracteres, ^ siempre significa el comienzo de la cadena, por lo que los signos de intercalación siempre deben ser de escape a menos que se utilicen para ese propósito. In D-Bus, all method calls must generate a reply to the caller, unless the caller explicitly indicates otherwise (see isReplyRequired()). QtDBus automatically generates such replies for any slots being called, but it also allows slots to indicate whether they will take responsibility of sending the reply at a later time, after the function has finished processing.

In D-Bus, all method calls must generate a reply to the caller, unless the caller explicitly indicates otherwise (see isReplyRequired()). QtDBus automatically generates such replies for any slots being called, but it also allows slots to indicate whether they will take responsibility of sending the reply at a later time, after the function has finished processing.
trans-unit.target: En D-Bus, todas las llamadas a métodos deben generar una respuesta a la persona que llama, a menos que la persona que llama indique explícitamente lo contrario (consulte isReplyRequired ()). QtDBus genera automáticamente dichas respuestas para cualquier espacio al que se llame, pero también permite que los espacios indiquen si asumirán la responsabilidad de enviar la respuesta en un momento posterior, una vez que la función haya terminado de procesarse.

trans-unit.source: In GUI programming, when we change one widget, we often want another widget to be notified. More generally, we want objects of any kind to be able to communicate with one another. For example, if a user clicks a Close button, we probably want the window's close() function to be called.

Por ejemplo, si un usuario hace clic en un botón Cerrar , probablemente queramos que se llame a la función close () de la ventana .

In Linux/X11 platforms, Qt provides support for session management. Sessions allow events to be propagated to processes, for example, to notify when a shutdown occurs. The process and applications can then perform any necessary operations such as save open documents.

trans-unit.source: In QByteArray, the notion of uppercase and lowercase and of case-independent comparison is limited to ASCII. Non-ASCII characters are treated as caseless, since their case depends on encoding. This affects functions that support a case insensitive option or that change the case of their arguments. Functions that this affects include contains(), indexOf(), lastIndexOf(), isLower(), isUpper(), toLower() and toUpper().

In QByteArray, the notion of uppercase and lowercase and of which character is greater than or less than another character is done in the Latin-1 locale. This affects functions that support a case insensitive option or that compare or lowercase or uppercase their arguments. Case insensitive operations and comparisons will be accurate if both strings contain only Latin-1 characters. Functions that this affects include contains(), indexOf(), lastIndexOf(), operator<(), operator<=(), operator>(), operator>=(), isLower(), isUpper(), toLower() and toUpper().

In Qt 5 all platforms are created using the Qt Platform Abstraction (QPA), which makes it easy to port Qt into a new operating system.

In Qt 5, QHash could be used to create multi-valued hashes by using QHash::insertMulti, and QMultiHash was deriving vom QHash.

In Qt 5, sizeof(QList<T>) was equal to a size of a pointer. Now, the extra pointer indirection is removed and QList data members are directly stored in the object. By default, expect sizeof(QList<T>) to be equal to the size of 3 pointers.

In Qt 5, QSGMaterialShader was tied to OpenGL. It was built directly on QOpenGLShaderProgram and had functions like updateState() that could issue arbitrary OpenGL commands. This is no longer the case in Qt 6. QSGMaterialShader is not strictly data-oriented, meaning it provides data (shaders and the desired pipeline state changes) together with logic that updates data in a uniform buffer. Graphics API access is not provided. This means that a QSGMaterialShader cannot make OpenGL, Vulkan, Metal, or Direct 3D calls on its own. Together with the unified shader management, this allows a QSGMaterialShader to be written once, and be functional with any of the supported graphics APIs at run time.
In Qt 5, a replacement set of OpenGL-support classes were added to Qt Gui. This was in order to support OpenGL as the cross-platform graphics API that served as foundation for graphics in Qt.

In Qt 5, effects were provided in form of GLSL (OpenGL Shading Language) source code, often embedded as strings into QML. Starting with Qt 5.8, referring to files, either local ones or in the Qt resource system, became possible as well.
In Qt 5, you would typically use a device spec under the
In Qt 5.0, Qt Quick always relied on OpenGL (OpenGL ES 2.0 or OpenGL 2.0) to parse the scene graph and render the results to a render target.

In Qt 5.10, these handlers were introduced in a separate Qt.labs.handlers module. Now they are included with Qt Quick since 5.12. The pre-existing Keys attached property is similar in concept, so we refer to the pointing-device-oriented handlers plus Keys together as the set of Input Handlers. We expect to offer more attached-property use cases in future versions of Qt.
trans-unit.target: En Qt 5.10, estos manipuladores se introdujeron en un módulo Qt.labs.handlers separado. Ahora están incluidos con Qt Quick desde 5.12. La propiedad adjunta Keys preexistente es similar en concepto, por lo que nos referimos a los manejadores orientados al dispositivo señalador más Keys juntos como el conjunto de manejadores de entrada. Esperamos ofrecer más casos de uso de propiedad adjunta en futuras versiones de Qt.

trans-unit.source: In Qt 5.4, there was an experimental implementation of high DPI scaling introduced via the QT_DEVICE_PIXEL_RATIO environment variable, that you could set to a numerical scale factor or auto. This variable was deprecated in Qt 5.6.

In Qt 6 QNetworkAccessManager enables HTTP/2 protocol by default. Depending on the scheme ("https" or "http"), QNetworkAccessManager will use the Application Layer Protocol Negotiation TLS extension or "protocol upgrade" HTTP header to negotiate HTTP/2. If HTTP/2 cannot be negotiated, the access manager will fall back to using HTTP/1.1. If your application can only use HTTP/1.1, you have to disable HTTP/2 manually on a new request:
In Qt 6 the default approach is to use automatic registration with the help of the build system. Instead of calling qmlRegisterType, the .pro file can now contain:
In Qt 6, +material becomes +Material:

In Qt 6, Qt Quick has support for graphics APIs, such as Vulkan, Metal, and Direct3D 11 as well. Therefore, working with GLSL source strings is no longer feasible. Rather, the new shader pipeline is based on compiling Vulkan-compatible GLSL code into SPIR-V, followed by gathering reflection information and translating into other shading languages, such as HLSL, the Metal Shading Language, and various GLSL versions. The resulting assets are packed together into a single package, typically stored in files with an extension of .qsb. This process is done offline or at application build time at latest. At run time, the scene graph and the underlying graphics abstraction consumes these .qsb files. Therefore, ShaderEffect expects file (local or qrc) references in Qt 6 in place of inline shader code.
In Qt 6, both the major and minor versions match, and version numbers may be omitted from imports in QML. If the version is omitted, the latest version will be used.
In Qt 6, both types and use cases are distinct, and QHash::insertMulti got removed.

In Qt 6, registration of comparators, and cQDebug and QDataStream streaming operators is done automatically. Consequently, QMetaType::registerEqualsComparator(), QMetaType::registerComparators(), qRegisterMetaTypeStreamOperators() and QMetaType::registerDebugStreamOperator() do no longer exist. Calls to those methods have to be removed when porting to Qt 6.

In Qt 6, the QProcess::start() overload that interprets a single command string by splitting it into program name and arguments is renamed to QProcess::startCommand(). However, a QProcess::start() overload that takes a single string, as well as a QStringList for arguments exists. Since the QStringList parameter defaults to the empty list, existing code only passing a string will still compile, but will fail to execute the process if it is a complete command string that includes arguments.

In Qt 6, the copy constructor and assignment operator for QEvent subclasses have been made protected to prevent implicit copying. If you need to copy events, use the clone method, which will return a heap-allocated copy of the QEvent object. Make sure you delete the clone, perhaps using std::unique_ptr, unless you post it (in which case Qt will delete it once it has been delivered).

In Qt 6, the default approach is to ship .qsb files with the application, typically embedded via the resource system, and referenced when calling setShaderFileName(). The .qsb files are generated offline, or at latest at application build time, from Vulkan-style GLSL source code using the qsb tool from the Qt Shader Tools module.

In Qt 6, the default redirect policy has changed from manual to QNetworkRequest::NoLessSafeRedirectPolicy. If your application relies on manual redirect handling (it connects its slot to the QNetworkReply::redirected signal), you have to explicitly set this policy when creating a request:

In Qt 6, the installation experience is easier and more flexible than before.The installation includes the Qt Essentials and a few of the most commonly used Qt Add-Ons. The Qt Add-Ons are moved outside of the main installation, but still available by running the installer. You can read the list of Qt modules in the Qt Modules page.
In Qt 6, the new QPromise class should be used instead of unofficial QFutureInterface as a "setter" counterpart of QFuture.
In Qt 6, there were some improvements to QFuture and QFutureWatcher which caused the following behavioral changes:

In Qt 6, these have been migrated to the Qt OpenGL module. They are still usable and fully supported for applications depending on OpenGL directly. However, they are no longer considered foundational, since Qt has been extended to support other graphics APIs in its foundation, such as Direct3D, Metal and Vulkan.

In Qt 6.0 inline shader strings are no longer supported, neither in Qt Quick nor in Qt Quick 3D. (make note of the fact that these properties are URLs, not strings) However, due to their intrinsically dynamic nature, custom materials and post-processing effects in Qt Quick 3D still provide shader snippets in source form in the referenced files. This is a difference to ShaderEffect where the shaders are complete on their own, with no further amending by the engine, and so are expected to be provided as pre-conditioned .qsb shader packs.
In Qt 6.0 the Canvas item supports one render target: Canvas.Image.
In Qt Creator, tested examples on iOS can be looked up. Use the ios keyword to search for examples in the Qt Creator Welcome mode. Note that some examples may have limited functionality.

trans-unit.source: In Qt Quick Controls 2, styles no longer provide components that are dynamically instantiated by controls, but controls themselves consist of item delegates that can be replaced. In effect, this means that delegates are Qt Quick items that are instantiated on the spot, as properties of the control, and are simply parented to the control.

In Qt Quick Controls, a style is essentially an interchangeable set of QML files within a single directory. There are three requirements for a style to be usable:

In Qt Quick Controls, styles no longer provide components that are dynamically instantiated by controls, but controls themselves consist of item delegates that can be replaced. In effect, this means that delegates are Qt Quick items that are instantiated on the spot, as properties of the control, and are simply parented to the control.

In Qt Quick however, it's normal for an Item or Event Handler to accept only the individual points in a QTouchEvent that are actually participating in a gesture, while other points can be delivered to other items or handlers. For the sake of consistency, that applies to any QPointerEvent; and delivery is done only when all points in a QPointerEvent have been accepted.
In Qt for Embedded Linux, painting is a pure software implementation. But starting with Qt 4.2, it is possible to add an accelerated graphics driver to take advantage of available hardware resources.

In Qt there is a often a need to represent the layout of the pixels in a graphics buffer. Internally QPixelFormat stores everything in a 64 bit datastructure. This gives performance but also some limitations.

trans-unit.source: In Qt, QTabBar uses the style to draw its tabs. Tabs exist either in a QTabWidget, which contains a QTabBar, or as a separate bar. If the bar is not part of a tab widget, it draws its own base.
trans-unit.target: En Qt, QTabBar usa el estilo para dibujar sus pestañas. Las pestañas existen en un QTabWidget , que contiene una QTabBar , o como una barra separada. Si la barra no es parte de un widget de pestaña, dibuja su propia base.

trans-unit.source: In Qt, Unicode characters are 16-bit entities without any markup or structure. This class represents such an entity. It is lightweight, so it can be used everywhere. Most compilers treat it like an unsigned short.
trans-unit.target: En Qt, los caracteres Unicode son entidades de 16 bits sin ningún marcado ni estructura. Esta clase representa tal entidad. Es liviano, por lo que se puede usar en todas partes. La mayoría de los compiladores lo tratan como un unsigned short .

trans-unit.target: En Qt,y en la mayoría de las aplicaciones que usan Qt,la mayoría o todas las cadenas visibles para el usuario se almacenan usando Unicode.Qt provee:

trans-unit.source: In Qt, events are objects, derived from the abstract QEvent class, that represent things that have happened either within an application or as a result of outside activity that the application needs to know about. Events can be received and handled by any instance of a QObject subclass, but they are especially relevant to widgets. This document describes how events are delivered and handled in a typical application.
trans-unit.target: En Qt, los eventos son objetos, derivados de la clase abstracta QEvent , que representan cosas que han sucedido dentro de una aplicación o como resultado de una actividad externa que la aplicación necesita conocer. Los eventos pueden ser recibidos y manejados por cualquier instancia de una subclase QObject , pero son especialmente relevantes para los widgets. Este documento describe cómo se envían y gestionan los eventos en una aplicación típica.

trans-unit.source: In Qt, only the QWidget::setFocusPolicy() function affects click-to-focus.
trans-unit.target: En Qt, solo la función QWidget :: setFocusPolicy () afecta el clic para enfocar.

trans-unit.source: In Qt, printers are represented by QPrinter, a paint device that provides functionality specific to printing, such as support for multiple pages and double-sided output. As a result, printing involves using a QPainter to paint onto a series of pages in the same way that you would paint onto a custom widget or image.
trans-unit.target: En Qt, las impresoras están representadas por QPrinter , un dispositivo de pintura que proporciona una funcionalidad específica para la impresión, como soporte para varias páginas y salida a doble cara. Como resultado, la impresión implica el uso de un QPainter para pintar en una serie de páginas de la misma manera que pintaría en un widget o imagen personalizados.

trans-unit.source: In Qt, the QAbstractButton base class provides most of the modes and other API, and QPushButton provides GUI logic. See QAbstractButton for more information about the API.
trans-unit.target: En Qt, la clase base QAbstractButton proporciona la mayoría de los modos y otras API, y QPushButton proporciona lógica GUI. Consulte QAbstractButton para obtener más información sobre la API.

In Qt, we have an alternative to the callback technique: We use signals and slots. A signal is emitted when a particular event occurs. Qt's widgets have many predefined signals, but we can always subclass widgets to add our own signals to them. A slot is a function that is called in response to a particular signal. Qt's widgets have many pre-defined slots, but it is common practice to subclass widgets and add your own slots so that you can handle the signals that you are interested in.
trans-unit.target: En Qt,tenemos una alternativa a la técnica de devolución de llamada:Usamos señales y ranuras.Se emite una señal cuando ocurre un evento particular.Los widgets de Qt tienen muchas señales predefinidas,pero siempre podemos subclasificar los widgets para añadirles nuestras propias señales.Una ranura es una función que se llama en respuesta a una señal particular.Los widgets de Qt tienen muchas ranuras predefinidas,pero es una práctica común subclasificar los widgets y añadir sus propias ranuras para poder manejar las señales que le interesan.

In QtRO, a node is an endpoint for communication. In a remote objects network, each participant, be it a process or a device, needs its own node. QtRO is a peer-to-peer network, with connected nodes being the links in the network.

In QtRO, the original object is called the Source. It's a fully-implemented C++ class, with the necessary business logic to provide the required functionality. Copies of this object are called Replicas. You don’t need to write any C++ code for a replica; you request an instance from a node instead. While you do need some code to use the replica, such as connecting signals to your own slots, you don’t need to implement the internal behavior – that's already done for you in the source.
In RPC, the client makes a request and waits for the response.
trans-unit.target: En la RPC,el cliente hace una solicitud y espera la respuesta.

trans-unit.source: In RPC, the server doesn't push anything to the client unless it's in response to a request.
trans-unit.target: En RPC,el servidor no envía nada al cliente a menos que sea en respuesta a una petición.

trans-unit.source: In TCP emulation mode, accepted clients use a single continuous byte stream for data transmission, and QSctpServer acts like a plain QTcpServer. Call nextPendingConnection() to accept the pending connection as a connected QTcpSocket. The function returns a pointer to a QTcpSocket in QAbstractSocket::ConnectedState that you can use for communicating with the client. This mode gives access only to basic SCTP protocol features. The socket transmits SCTP packets over IP at system level and interacts through the QTcpSocket interface with the application.
trans-unit.target: En el modo de emulación TCP, los clientes aceptados utilizan un solo flujo de bytes continuo para la transmisión de datos, y QSctpServer actúa como un QTcpServer simple . Llame a nextPendingConnection () para aceptar la conexión pendiente como un QTcpSocket conectado . La función devuelve un puntero a un QTcpSocket en QAbstractSocket :: ConnectedState que puede utilizar para comunicarse con el cliente. Este modo da acceso solo a las funciones básicas del protocolo SCTP. El socket transmite paquetes SCTP sobre IP a nivel de sistema e interactúa a través de la interfaz QTcpSocket con la aplicación.

trans-unit.source: In TCP emulation mode, accepted clients use a single continuous byte stream for data transmission, and QSctpServer acts like a plain QTcpServer. Call nextPendingConnection() to accept the pending connection as a connected QTcpSocket. The function returns a pointer to a QTcpSocket in QAbstractSocket::ConnectedState that you can use for communicating with the client. This mode gives access only to basic SCTP protocol features. The socket transmits SCTP packets over IP at system level and interacts through the QTcpSocket interface with the application.

trans-unit.source: In Unicode, comparison is not necessarily possible and case conversion is very difficult at best. Unicode, covering the "entire" world, also includes most of the world's case and sorting problems. operator==() and friends will do comparison based purely on the numeric Unicode value (code point) of the characters, and toUpper() and toLower() will do case changes when the character has a well-defined uppercase/lowercase equivalent. For locale-dependent comparisons, use QString::localeAwareCompare().
trans-unit.target: En Unicode, la comparación no es necesariamente posible y la conversión de casos es, en el mejor de los casos, muy difícil. Unicode, que cubre el mundo "entero", también incluye la mayoría de los casos y problemas de clasificación del mundo. operator == () y sus amigos harán una comparación basada puramente en el valor numérico Unicode (punto de código) de los caracteres, y toUpper () y toLower () harán cambios de mayúsculas y minúsculas cuando el carácter tenga un equivalente en mayúsculas / minúsculas bien definido. Para comparaciones dependientes de la configuración regional, use QString :: localeAwareCompare ().

trans-unit.source: In Windows a request for the "Courier" font is automatically changed to "Courier New", an improved version of Courier that allows for smooth scaling. The older "Courier" bitmap font can be selected by setting the PreferBitmap style strategy (see setStyleStrategy()).
trans-unit.target: En Windows, una solicitud de la fuente "Courier" se cambia automáticamente a "Courier New", una versión mejorada de Courier que permite escalar sin problemas. La fuente de mapa de bits "Courier" más antigua se puede seleccionar configurando la estrategia de estilo PreferBitmap (consulte setStyleStrategy ()).

In a QGraphicsScene with stickyFocus set to true, focus will remain unchanged when the user clicks into the scene background or on an item that does not accept focus. Otherwise, focus will be cleared.

In a Unicode context some positions in the text are not valid cursor positions, because the position is inside a Unicode surrogate or a grapheme cluster.
trans-unit.target: En un contexto de Unicode,algunas posiciones en el texto no son posiciones válidas del cursor,porque la posición está dentro de un sustituto de Unicode o un grupo de grafos.
